qas.question: When was Brazil's fall of the monarchy?
Who caused the fall of the monarchy happened in Brazil?

answers.text: military coup d'état led to the rise of the presidential system, headed by Deodoro da Fonseca.

qas.question: What other system does Brazil use?
When was Brazil's rise of the monarchy?

plausible_answers.text: military coup d'état led to the rise of the presidential system, headed by Deodoro da Fonseca

qas.question: Who didn't cause the fall of the monarchy that happened in Brazil?
What other system does Brazil reject?

context: In Brazil, the fall of the monarchy in <a0_0><b5_0>1889<b5_0/><a0_0/> by a <a1_0><b6_0>military coup d'état led to the rise of the presidential system, headed by Deodoro da Fonseca<b6_0/>.<a1_0/> Aided by well-known jurist Ruy Barbosa, Fonseca established federalism in Brazil by decree, but this system of government would be confirmed by every Brazilian constitution since <a2_0><b7_0>1891<b7_0/><a2_0/>, although some of them would distort some of the federalist principles. The 1937 Constitution, for example, granted the federal government the authority to appoint State Governors (called interventors) at will, thus centralizing power in the hands of President Getúlio Vargas. Brazil also uses the <a3_0><b8_0>Fonseca system<b8_0/><a3_0/> to <a4_0><b9_0>regulate interstate trade<b9_0/><a4_0/>. Brazil is one of the biggest federal governments.
